website_summaries.verdict: Once assembled and properly weighted, homeowners with larger yards are happy with this towable, wide lawn aerator.
pros: Attaches easily to riding mower or ATV
Rolls smoothly behind mower and works in forward or reverse
Responsive customer service and fast warranty parts replacement

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job aerating my lawns
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job aerating my lawns. I used some top soil bags to weigh it down and pulled it behind my ATV. I have the greenest lawn on the block now!
customer_reviews.author: KTH

customer_reviews.title: Brinly tow behind aerator
customer_reviews.text: A very well made tool for any home owner with a riding tractor. It took a long time to assemble. For those previous reviewers that said it only took you 30 minutes.... You are either a proud person or you are a wizard because there is no way to complete assembly that quickly. I will say that it had a solid build quality. Thick powder coating, heavy gauge steel, solid fasteners, etc. If you are looking for a tow behind aerator, this is the unit to buy. I did all the research for you. Your lawn will be greener and healthier than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Olberding

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was fairly easy. I had to use a rat tail file on one hole to get the bolt through--no big deal. There were a few inconsistencies with the bolts as a few other reviewers mentioned. The machine works well. It's very easy to pull behind my John Deere D130. The mechanism to raise and lower the spoons is smooth and effective. That's a nice feature when you need to cross the driveway. The directions say to check the tightness of all bolts after a half hours of use. I found several that needed more tightening. One spoon fell off but fortunately I found it and re-attached it. I used a few pavers as weights in the tray.
customer_reviews.author: Stan57Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Cat Turd Maker 3000
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a year now and I feel it has made a big difference in my lawn already. The install was easy just time consuming. I was missing the small pin that holds the lever back so I just used a spare bolt. I emailed support awhile ago and they sent me one no questions asked. I waited till we had some rain and soon my yard was filled with little cat turds.
customer_reviews.author: N. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought "used" $160. Missing parts, contacted manufacture and they shipped out all the parts for free. You have to get off the tractor to engage and disengage... should of been designed better. Difficult to back up and make sharp turns. Unit should of been designed longer to avoid hitting your rear tires. A drill with a uni-bit makes assembling the spoons much easier. You do not want to ream the holes with a rat tail file by hand. My yard is rocky and lots of exposed tree roots. I did not damage a single spoon, to my surprise. I used 3 cinder blocks for weight. Construction is heavy duty and made in America. Great customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: When I did a ton of research on a good tow behind aerator and this one kept coming up so I though it was the best to order. It was a pain to put together because the instructions sucked. In addition, I tried to use this and it wouldn’t even put plugs into my lawn besides a few sandy areas. I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: BRW

customer_reviews.title: Aerates
customer_reviews.text: Instructions for assembly somewhat confusing/difficult to decipher. Parts sufficiently labeled but instructions sketchy. Weight tray a bit small as concrete block won't fit easily. Either too loose or too small to accommodate a standard concrete block.
customer_reviews.author: howard mcallister

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomend!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and used it for the first time 2 weeks ago (and also bought the separate de thatcher). I love it. I used 2 cinder blocks and 50 pounds of weights and it did just as well as the big rental machines. Plus it was so easy as I pulled it behind my Craftsman riding mower. Install was easy. I didn't read the instructions closely enough and had to take 3 of the spikes off and reinstall opposite the "weld" side, bit other than that it was simple to do. 2 of my neighbors asked me to do their yard because mine did so well....and I did theirs in no time as well. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great after multiple passes
customer_reviews.text: Missing some hardware at first but called the company directly and they had them to me next day. Had to strap 4 50lb cinder blocks to the back which was no problem to achieve the full 3" plug depth that I wanted. Worked great after multiple passes. My neighbor was asking if I could do his lawn next.....lol. Laid down 4 50lb bags of grass seed after and watered heavily. After 3 days I already have little sprouts coming in. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Andy Kolar

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Assembly is tedious. Lawn is doing great since areating.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this aerator since early 2018. I have used it twice. It took a while to assemble (lots of parts). Not difficult, but tedious. I am very happy with it. I run it behind my ride on lawnmower. The hardest part (not that hard) is to make sure the weight tray has enough weight on it. I use concrete blocks that are designed to support the base of a shed. I tie them down with bungie cords. My lawn is much healthier since I started areating. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kartik

customer_reviews.title: Product Review 3 YEARS later
customer_reviews.text: I used my aerator yesterday and as always was delighted with its performance. In fact I felt obligated to write this review to share my opinion having used this for three years now. I had my son assemble it, it seemed like that would be a bit tough. My ground is real hard, I wait for a few days of rain then take it out and put it to work. I am amazed at how well this "cheap" homeowner's rig performs. I put 8 cement bricks on it (maybe 20 lb each) and the holes that it makes are about the size and length of my index finger.
customer_reviews.author: Tacoma, WA

customer_reviews.title: Needs Plenty of Weight
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived in good condition. Assembly was not difficult; instructions were fairly straight forward. The first time I used it I put 100 lbs on the tray. It was not breaking the surface of the ground consistently, so I added another 35 lb. The aerator was then able to create/extract good plugs in all but the areas with very hard packed soil. It's rated to hold up to 150 lb, so I can still add more weight if need be. Overall, I satisfied with the job it did.
customer_reviews.author: EdW

customer_reviews.title: PhD Needed
customer_reviews.text: You need a PhD and plenty of time to assemble this unit. It is complicated and the directions are not the greatest. The unit works well for the price but plenty of improvements can be made. A majority of the paint for the unit was scratched when I opened the box and it took 3+ hours to assemble and my hands were sore after. You need a second person who is able to help you as well. The unit "fingers" should come pre assembled as it will still fit in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Krieger

customer_reviews.title: Brinly Aerator
customer_reviews.text: This would have gotten a 5 start, but is a little hard to put together. I took me three hours. Bolting the tines on was the hard part. Those nuts were tough to turn. I guess they don't want them falling off. Also, I have a bad back, so that slowed me down as well. The instructions were very clear. All the parts were there ( lots of nuts). It pulls about a 2" plug with just 60lbs of weight added. That is all the weight I had available. My mower is a Troy-Bilt 30 inch. It is only 10.5 HP. It pulled it with no problem( I have no hills in my yard). Great little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Glen R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Plugging along....
customer_reviews.text: It works and pulls an inch and a half plug out of the lawn for better water and air penetration to the roots. I spread some Winter weed and feed mix this Fall and am hoping for some nicer results on my 2 acres of spotty patchwork pasture grasses. I will add another aerator pass this Spring followed by a Springtime blend fertilizer treatment. Then we'll see what results we get for the Summer growing season.
customer_reviews.author: K Hoy

customer_reviews.title: Good basic plug aerator for large yard
customer_reviews.text: It’s OK. Plug blades are not sharp in the least. Going to need to sharpen them next season. The instructions listed the incorrect socket and wrench sizes for the assembly. If you’re not big into putting it together yourself you’re gonna need a six pack. Easy to use make sure you have two to three large cinder blocks and if there’s a drought like 2020 your depth is gonna be 1-2 inches in compacted soil. I’m happy with the purchase and will keep this for next 3-5 seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: It Did Work
customer_reviews.text: I have used the aerator once so far. I added two cement blocks for weight, which is about 52 pounds. It did work. However, next time I will try to add some more weight to try address really hard packed areas as well as run-of-the-mill areas in general. I ran it two or three days after a rain. Next time I will try the day right after a rain, unless we have had a deluge. I'm satisfied with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to assemble and lightweight enough to maneuver around by hand. I loaded it up with the 150# necessary to reach the 3" depth and hooked it to my ride-on lawnmower. The plugs were the precise size I wanted. Clean up is easy, just use a garden hose to spay the corers clean. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to improve their lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the machine. It took me about two hours to plug 2 acres but it desperately needed it. My yard is greener than my neighbors with a relatively dry spring along the FL/GA line. I do not water my yard either. Only recommendation is to place a coat of rustoluem paint after your first use to prevent any rust from developing. If it's too late they sell replacement spoons. Assembly took about 90 minutes with an impact drill and a toddler asking me "what's this?" a thousand times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Parts came with a lot of rust
customer_reviews.text: So far, the impression is being negative. Some larts came wit a lot of rust and the instruction are bad - a simple label in the screws would fix this issue, until then, there is a lot kf guessing that you will need to do. I am doing a core aeration next month, so I will update depending on the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Gandra

customer_reviews.title: For an american product, it needs some upgrades
customer_reviews.text: I assembled and put 60 Lbs. of weight in tray. Don't have a very big yard, but when I looked down the cheap plastic wheels fell apart. I had to purchase STEEL wheels from a hardware , which were expensive. The whole wheel assembly unit needs to be revamped. Will Never recommend to another person. Should buy from China next time.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy for a homeowner model
customer_reviews.text: It took about 2.5 hours to assemble. I’m guessing I could have saved 15 minutes because my battery on my power drill ran out. The sturdiness of the equipment is very good, maybe a step sturdier than a homeowner needs which made me happy. I recommend this product if you have the interest in airating your lawn. I had no choice to test it in not so desirable conditions and I was happy with the outcome. I have clay soil and will wait to use it after enough rainfall. I used empty sparkle buckets and filled with sand. I used two buckets which equated to 100 lbs. I will add another 50 lbs next time.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I’m glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to buy this because of some reviews posted 3+ years ago. People had received boxes with missing parts and difficult assembly instructions. Mine came with all the parts, nuts, bolts and washers. Assembly instructions were perfectly clear to me. I do recommend having a ratchet set and open end wrench. Once assembled it exceeded my expectations. Parts of my yard were pretty firmly packed. After a good rain storm this aerator penetrated those areas quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Aerator
customer_reviews.text: Time consuming assembly, I added heavy duty axle grease to the “axle” during assembly to protect against future corrosion. Not impressed with plastic bearings. Add enough weight to the tray, make sure your lawn has been recently watered, then you will get 2-3 inch plugs from hard compacted soil.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Vague instructions and missing hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Quality control is very likely a problem at Brinly. The product instructions were like a puzzle and there were several bolts with nuts missing from the packaging. The packaging stated that the product was inspected by Tim. Tim did not do his/her job.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Henson

customer_reviews.title: Not tried it yet.  (bolt is in the way of the tines?
customer_reviews.text: Came today - box is HEAVY. I had it together in about 60 minutes. Maybe 70. Easy build, decent instructions. however. one of the bolts protrudes into the tines no the right. I inspected the instructions and appears I did it right. ??? No worries - other than (weird) I'll reverse the bolts tomorrow and put the nuts on the outside of the wheel. A couple extra bushings would have allowed me to push the bolt out a bit... but no spares included. If it works well, I'll up it to 4 or 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Took a while to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Somehow it didn't get assembled well. Had to move pieces around several times. It's very light weight so I put several bricks on top so it can poke into the ground. Which makes loud sound whenever using them. For the last 3 months, I use them about 5-6 times and works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: S.B

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: Excellent instructions, material quality as well. Shipping found box was slightly open due to tape not secured, no banding. Found bag of screws was loose within box due to razor slit on plastic bag, contents emptied inside of box. Only one screw was missing. Contacted Customer Service via their Web site and register the product, Excellent response, replaced with the entire bundle of screws,bolts, nuts next day. Used the product was very please with the results. Recommend this product...
customer_reviews.author: OPA

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN USA!!! EASY 1 Hour to Assembly with right tools (Open end wrenches 3/8", 7/16", and 1/2"
customer_reviews.text: MADE IN USA! This product came with the best instructions I have seen in a long time. Thick high quality metal used. Powder coated parts except tines. Nice adjustments for different trail hitch heights. The packaging for the bolts, washers, and nuts was top shelf. Organized on a nice cardboard sheet labeled and boxed so you knew what to grab for each step without having to keep looking at the instructions. This company clearly knows what people hate about assembling their products and truly made it as easy as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B. Melson

customer_reviews.title: It works at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure how this would work at such a low price, but it did fine. It's light enough to tow behind my zero turn mower and the tines are sharp enough to pull plugs out of the ground. So mission accomplished. I will be able to aerate my lawn two or three times a year. The assembly instructions had incorrect nut sizes listed, but I was able to sort through that and put it together in about 90 minutes (not rushing).
customer_reviews.author: flyingairedale

customer_reviews.title: All you need for small to med yard.
customer_reviews.text: Takes awhile to assemble but instructions were simple to follow for the average dyi's with good diagrams. Materials are of sturdy quality for the price. I weighed the sled down with 150# of dumbells and waited a few days after a good rain and this aerator outperformed my expectations pulling nice plugs out allowing for easy sewing and good aeration. Wish I found this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: CAMPIONE67

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it took a little while to put together but did not have any problems. Take your time and read the instructions. No missing parts. I used a small impact wrench which made the job so much easier. Very nice build quality. Look forward to using in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Grooven Reuven

customer_reviews.title: Looks sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of all the great reviews about ease of assembly and clear directions. The box was ripped and the item was scratched . The directions were also missing, after we found them on the internet and printed them it took a little over 2 hours to assemble. It looks sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: and I am glad I finally realized the need for it
customer_reviews.text: I received my 40 inch aerator 2 days ago. first off, this is a well built piece of equipment, and I am glad I finally realized the need for it. It takes a while to assemble, but don't let that deter you. The instructions are perfect, and the finished unit did a fantastic job, pulling out beautiful cores from my yard. I can't wait to use it again, I know it will help my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Frank R

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This product will take about 2 hours to properly assemble and you will need cement blocks or sand bags to weigh it down. It does an acceptable job of aerating the lawn but if your yard is very compacted, you will need to water heavily for a couple of days before you aerate.
customer_reviews.author: President & CEO

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works well. It’s able to take turns OK because the tines are in three individually rotating sections, so the outside set can rotate faster than the inside set when you make a turn. Easy but tedious to assemble, because each individual tine must be bolted to its spindle.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Just need cinder blocks
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried after reading other reviews about putting this together but wasn’t to bad. Instructions were clear and took about 2 hrs but not difficult. Just tedious. Worth it considering what you have to pay a landscaper to do once.
customer_reviews.author: radio reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice plugs!
customer_reviews.text: Strong, sturdy aerator that’s simple to attach to a tractor. It leaves nice plugs for a healthy lawn and is easy to clean. I placed rubber table mats in it to keep the cement blocks from scratching and eventually rusting it out.
customer_reviews.author: LAR

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great to refurbish a compacted lawn. Assembly is a pain but this is heavy duty and not cheaply built. Local hard ware store visit is needed to buy blocks for weighting down. It tore up my clay perfectly with deep plugs. Down side is getting on and off the lawn mower to raise/lower the times when coming to a driveway or sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: E. Drum

customer_reviews.title: Solid and pays for itself!
customer_reviews.text: Take your time assembling this. I had an impact wrench which really helped. I loaded the back with paver stones and did my whole yard pulling with my D105 tractor. I overseeded and now my yard is the best on the street. I plan to aerate spring and fall every year. Paying for a company to come out would have easily cost as much as this unit. I expect it to last many years.
customer_reviews.author: irobb

customer_reviews.title: The knucklebuster
customer_reviews.text: Would of gave it a five but assembly is tedious, not hard just tedious. Once together ran it around with 2 60lb sand bags after it rained. Wasn't getting the results I hoped and added a third sand bag and it worked great. Great product does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dweezel

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Storage is a little awkward as it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Storage is a little awkward as it is a relatively large piece of equipment. Assembly is easy to understand but attaching the individual tines one at a time can be tough as the angles are difficult to apply the pressure needed to make the locking bolts sit down tight, but you only have to do that once. One week after aerating for the first time I saw real results. I have already had neighbors ask to borrow it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Flournoy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this product but it works as advertised. Took about 1.5 hrs. to assemble. A cordless impact gun will make things much easier. There are some typos in the instructions so read them thoroughly. After assembly I attached to my lawn tractor. I put 3 cinder blocks in for weight plus 3 granite cobblestones. Towed it around my yard in 1st speed. It made holes about an inch and a half deep. My area is in a drought so the ground is really hard. Probably have better penetration the day after a good rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did a nice job aerating my yard
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took about 2 hours, but it worked really well. It took me about 15 min to aerate my lawn, instead of two or three hours with the push aerator I have previously rented. I think the plugs were not quite as deep as those made by the powered aerator I rented in the past, but it seems like it should be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Jazo

customer_reviews.title: well made - well designed
customer_reviews.text: the unit was well-made and well-designed - and seems to havebeen the right choice among the options for me. Assembly was tedious and time consuming, but not really difficult. Good purchase
customer_reviews.author: davem

customer_reviews.title: ... Amazon and for the most part have been very pleased. This my absolute first review
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered so many items from Amazon and for the most part have been very pleased. This my absolute first review. Putting this thing together was a NIGHTMARE it took hours to assemble and the bolts are the correct sizes. What a mess. I would loved to return it. But I already put it together. After losing a few pounds sweating and busting my knuckles I was able to use the item. I put 80 pounds of dry concrete on both sides and it worked well actually
customer_reviews.author: B. David

customer_reviews.title: Performs Great
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to assemble. However, I do recommend the use of an air wrench to reduce fatigue during installation of the tines. Excellent performance on hard clay. Notwithstanding, the lever for raising and lowering the unit appears to be made of cold rolled (drawn) steel as opposed to hot rolled. Hence, there's little "spring"- care must be used to avoid bending the lever. All in all, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: this was the best option. It took some time to put together ...
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around quite a bit for this product and for the quality and size, this was the best option. It took some time to put together but it is pretty solid quality. Many of my friends have borrowed it and it has not loosened at all during several trips in my truck. It works significantly better than the spike aerator's. I would recommend and buy other products from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: great product for the price, I only gave 4 stars due to the amount of assembly time and physical strength that was required. (looking back the price may have reflected the personal labor involved.) I would have paid a bit more if the spoons were pre assembled to the square brackets but that's my only real complaint as everything else was easily manageable. one word of advice, this is going to take a while to assemble and get power tools to assist as you do not want to do this by hand! overall very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: B-Rock

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Cost Efficient,  Great service!!
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to work as advertised. Easy to put together and seems to be extremely durable. 3 plugs were missing in box, called customer service and they had replacement to my doorstep within two days!!! Excellent service. Aerated just over an acre of land without issue. Expect to use this product a lot in the coming years. Will follow up if it does not withstand the test of time, otherwise, extremely happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: affordable , gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, I think it matched exactly what it advertised, and matched its price.... it got the job done, these are never as good at aerating as the expensive aeration machines... but that's okay by me.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use
customer_reviews.text: You will want to make a crossing pattern, and if seeding maybe even do it twice. I used 4 bags of black kow compost for weight with moist soil. Definitely do not dried out soil. It will plug deep the day after a rain.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: works like a champ, creating generous plugs that fly out of the intruders. I used this on our 3 acre lawn several times now and I still love it!
customer_reviews.author: HockeyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Had it put together and to work in a little less than an hour. It worked perfectly! exactly what I was hoping for. It's good quality. And should hold up for many years. It was a great investment and will pay for itself pretty quick. Way better than running behind the walk behind rentals
customer_reviews.author: stark

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: It took a while to assemble but, once done, it worked perfectly. It does a great job pulling little plugs out of the lawn. After aeration, we will apply compost and seed. We’re going to have a beautiful lawn! It was easy to attach to the lawn tractor.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Orlean

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived very quickly. Assembly was very easy if you read and follow the directions. Using a air impact wrench really speed-ed up the assembly process. I added two 50lb bags of stones to the tray to weigh it down the first time I used it. My only complaint was that the first time I used it the wheel support bend and the wheel stopped turning. I had to straighten out the wheel using a crowbar and hammer to make it operational again. It took nice deep plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Joffe

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality of this product and the easiness of assembly. It worked great. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Russell

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Took a little time to assemble but good instructions. Well made and solid. Not sure how long plastic bushings will last
customer_reviews.author: ted

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts nuts and transport lock pin b-3307-s. Making product unusable. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon Party

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a good quality product but missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited to receive the aerator for my overseeding project. Assembly seem pretty easy and steel seemed pretty sturdy and has good build quality, but realized I was missing the two side pieces that hold the axle. I made sure I had everything else then contacted customer service which were really helpful and sent me the missing pieces. Now I gotta wait a few more days to get my overseeding done. Overall I bet it’s gonna get the job done and last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Got a great deal, took time to put togther but worth it. Used it and performed great.
customer_reviews.text: Got a great deal, took time to put together but worth it. Used it and performed great. Company shipped missing pieces ASAP when contacted. Great customer service! Will by from again.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: received it yesterday, missing pc. 15, calling ...
customer_reviews.text: received it yesterday ,missing pc. 15 ,calling brinly this am and will update later.
customer_reviews.author: johnny b

customer_reviews.title: As promised
customer_reviews.text: Works great but sent without needed parts. Made a phone calls and quickly sent parts.
customer_reviews.author: Louis F.

customer_reviews.title: Parts are well built but assembly is terrible. Every hole for the blades is slightly off ...
customer_reviews.text: Parts are well built but assembly is terrible. Every hole for the blades is slightly off making assembly twice as difficult as it should be. Also, the washers for the bolts that hold on the blades were missing. They need to work on quality control. Otherwise it seems ok. I have yet to actually test it out.
customer_reviews.author: matthew young

customer_reviews.title: Easy and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This is nice to have and easy to use. We found keeping empty plastic gallon milk bottles on it was perfect for added weight, just fill with water when you’re ready to use and dump out for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Pulls plugs like advertised Iam very satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.author: Surffshr

customer_reviews.title: Nice aerator!
customer_reviews.text: Great aerator for a great price. Pay attention to the instructions. Inventory at the beginning and organize. It's pretty smooth sailing after that. It's very durable and does what it's supposed to do provided you put weight on it. I have 180 pounds on currently and that does fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Blevins

customer_reviews.title: works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: works like a champ!! saved my self a ton of money, versus paying some douche to charge me an arm and a leg to air rate my yard every year..
customer_reviews.author: Buckeyebeast

customer_reviews.title: Does and excellent job!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a little confusing at times, but I got it together without too much trouble. Just take your time and read the instructions before you assemble it. I pull it behind my mower and it does what it's supposed to...punches holes and pulls out the plugs. Seems to be very sturdy with heavy gauge steel.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Janke

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this Aerator. Glad I went with this one over the Agri-fab. This is a solid, well built device. Left perfect size holes in really tough clay/ Rocky soil. Assembly took about 30min. Worth the time and effort. Thanks Brinly!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Aerified my lawn last week and already seeing change. Going to do it again in the fall. Much easier to use than renting a machine. Not as hard to put together as others have written. It took me about 45 minutes to an hour. In the long run this is going to save time and money over renting one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not simple to put together, but worth the work!
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sturdy and effective! This should last a long time and plan on many successful uses. After seeing our yard plugged friends are already asking if I can take care of their yards for them. This would be the only drawback at this time. 🤦‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Bruce L.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and works well
customer_reviews.text: Have only used once but it worked as advertised. It is a project to get it put together but had all the parts and instructions were satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Luke S.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but needs modifications
customer_reviews.text: For the low rating is because of poor directions and instructions.... also the pin doesn’t line up properly when your not wanting to penetrate the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse L. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This aerator is awesome. Yes, it does take a while to put together. But honestly to make it able to be shipped they had to manufacture everything in separate prices. That all being said, I was sceptical based on the price however it pulls out perfect plugs in my lawn and I can already see the difference it has made. I am very pleased with this product and would recommend it to anyone looking for a tow behind aerator.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Spear

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job even on droit stricken ground. Easy to use and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: christian f.

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: it seems to be a little flimsy but I'll see how it goes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because i wanted to aerate and seed myself. I live in the northeast and have a shaded backyard. I just aerated to put shade mix seed down. The aerator worked great!!!! Happy with my purchase!! Sturdy material. Used 2 8x8x16 blocks and no issues. Took me a hour and half to put together.
customer_reviews.author: eddie

customer_reviews.title: assembled just fine, and worked great
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy, assembled just fine, and worked great. You will, as others have said, need to pile some weight onto it. It made nice holes and didn't plug up.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ehmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Item, but super time consuming to put together
customer_reviews.text: Great item but it takes a long time to put together. Its not hard, but it takes too long
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and really works well
customer_reviews.text: Really a good product and works really well, but it is H_ll putting it together. All part were there, but the hitch pin did not have a hole in it for the cotter pin that was supplied. I had to use my own bolt and nut to replace the hitch pin.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Bryant

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Never aerated before, but used this unit yesterday and it did an excellent job. Plugs were about 2.5 inches. The components are high quality and all were included, but as others have stated it did take some time to assemble. It would be nice if the spoons came assembled to the plates.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great affordable aerator. Could be made a little stronger but decent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Christen

customer_reviews.title: This machine worked well. Took an hour to assemble ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked well. Took an hour to assemble. I used 160 lbs. of weight. Had to make several passes. I couldn't pull it up a hill with my lawn tractor with the plugger down, but I could drive up the hill then engage the plugger and drive down, took longer but i only do it once or twice a year.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Parsons

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: seems well made and easy to assemble for the price
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I have about two acres of hard dirt in my yard. This did impress me how it went in ground about 2 inches deep and soften the ground. It is very sturdy. Add about 70 pounds of weight and works great
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to assemble, but it's simple assembly. Sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Ace47

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Not to hard to put together and worked great being pulled behind my mower.
customer_reviews.author: splauber

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This thing works way better than I expected. It took less than an hour to complete the 8 assembly steps. The instructions are very clear. I have almost two acres of lawn and I was about to airate the entire very easily. I loaded the top with concrete bricks and hooked it up to my Husqvarna lawn tractor.
customer_reviews.author: jbelanger2002

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Everything I was hoping for, strong, stable, sturdy. Right well made, works as advertised, couldn't be happier and my green lawn is pretty happy too.
customer_reviews.author: Collin P.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be about like professional aerators
customer_reviews.text: I like the price. It seems to sturdy. I have had a stroke but was able to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Really good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine lawn creator. Tedious assembly but worth it. Patience will be rewarded.
customer_reviews.author: Dark, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Just time consuming and annoying. Works well otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the a** to put together. Just time consuming and annoying. Works well otherwise
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM I.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I used two eighty pound bags of concrete and it was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was not that hard and it works like a champ. Very pleased with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: E. Turschmann

customer_reviews.title: Works great and awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, the axle bar was bent. Called customer service and they were awesome! Got the new bar in and I've used it a few times. It works great! It took a little time to put together, but it wasn't hard and the directions are good.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Good aerator!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, well built. I have a big lawn, and this aerator handled it
customer_reviews.author: jsansa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Follow the instructions and it works well. It does need quite a bit of weight.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: would not buy
customer_reviews.text: pokes holes in the ground does not pull the plug would not recommend this machine to anyone
customer_reviews.author: sbdfw79

customer_reviews.title: Missing a lot of hardware
customer_reviews.text: I received and it is missing the 1” bolts and about 20 of the washers. I still don’t have it setup
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F.

product_meta.title: Brinly PA-40BH Tow Behind Plug Aerator, 40-Inch
product_meta.description: If heavily compacted or clay-rich soil is choking your lawn, then the Brinly 40" Towable plug aerator is your solution for healthy, lush grass. Many landscapers & gardeners don’t realize that lawn aeration is a vital step to a beautiful yd. Without it, a lawn's roots can be deprived of air & needed nutrients. Unlike spike aerating - which slices grooves in the soil - plug aeration actually extracts soil plugs to open spaces for roots to expand & to allow air, water, & fertilizers to get to the root system. After aerating, the soil "plugs" Are left behind on the lawn to break down & Return vital nutrients back into the soil, promoting healthy growth. Indiana-based brinly-hardy company has been manufacturing quality lawn & garden attachments since 1839 taking the work out of DIY yd. Maintenance only gets more effortless with each Brinly product in our broad line of durable attachments. The best yd. Require the best tools get a yd. Like the pros with Brinly!
feature_bullets: Aerate & Relieve Compacted Soil: 24 heat-treated, 16-gauge Steel plugging spoons penetrate compacted soil and remove up to 3-inch plugs of soil, allowing water, seed, and fertilizer to reach the roots. Brinly plug design is narrower with sharpened ends to allow easier penetration and require less weight.

Long-lasting construction: durable, all steel design with Fully-Enclosed Weight tray holds up to 150 pounds of any type of extra weight for maximum soil penetration and depth. Tines are heat-treated for strength. No flat wheels for durability.
Easy transport: for crossing drives, walks and rooted areas, Brinly plug aerator includes a single transport lever to engage transport mode using the 10" Never flat rubber tread tires.
Works safely on turns & uneven terrain: three independently rotating, Welded Tine sections minimize turf damage during turns and help provide consistent penetration on uneven ground
Universal Hitch: a single pin, universal Hitch easily attaches to every lawn tractor and most ztrs and ATVs.
